Tolkien|author]]) * [[2023]]: [[HarperCollins]] hardcover in slipcase, ISBN 0008627835 - (illustrated by the author) ** 2023: 1996 paperback edition, 73rd impression * [[2025]]: [[HarperCollins]] hardcover in slipcase, ISBN 978-0008779900 - (illustrated by Alan Lee, deluxe slipcase edition) ==Graphic novel== In [[1989]] ''The Hobbit'' was adapted in a three issue comic book series, published by Eclipse Comics. The story was adapted from the original by Chuck Dixon, and illustrated by David T. Wenzel. They were bound in one volume trade paperback in [[1990]], and newer editions have been released in the following years.[https://tolkienlibrary.com/press/1110-the-hobbit-comics.php The Hobbit Comics adapted by Chuck Dixon] at TolkienLibrary.com File:The Hobbit graphic-1989-1.jpeg ‎|1989 paperback comic vol.1 File:The Hobbit graphic-1989-2.jpeg ‎|1989 paperback comic vol.2 File:The Hobbit graphic-1989-3.jpeg ‎|1989 paperback comic vol.3 File:The Hobbit graphic-1990.jpeg ‎|1990 paperback one-volume File:The Hobbit graphic-2006.jpeg ‎|2006 paperback one-volume File:The Hobbit graphic-2012.jpeg ‎|2012 paperback one-volume File:The Hobbit graphic-2024.jpg ‎|2024 paperback one-volume File:The Hobbit graphic 2025.jpeg ‎|2025 paperback one-volume expanded * Separate volumes ** [[1989]]: Eclipse Comics, paperback, ISBN 0913035807 (vol.1) ** [[1989]]: Eclipse Comics, paperback, ISBN 0913035815 (vol.2) ** [[1989]]: Eclipse Comics, paperback, ISBN 0913035823 (vol.3) * One-volume ** [[1990]]: Eclipse Comics, paperback, ISBN 0345368584 ** [[2006]]: [[HarperCollins]], paperback, ISBN 0261102664 ** [[2012]]: Del Rey - Ballantine, paperback, ISBN 0345445600 ** [[2024]]: William Morrow, paperback, pp. 144.
